newsitem.title: THAILAND: Thai baht, interbank rate up in late trade.
newsitem.headline: Thai baht, interbank rate up in late trade.

text.p: The Thai baht was higher against the dollar in late trade on Tuesday on U.S. unit's further fall abroad and tighter liquidity, dealers said.
The baht was quoted at 25.954/25.959 to the dollar late compared with 25.958/25.961 in early morning.
"The liquidity was tighter today with rising short-term baht interest rates. This triggered some interest in the baht," said one dealer at a local bank.
The tightening liquidity pushed the overnight interbank rate up to 9.75-10.00 percent late 7.50-8.00 earlier, dealers said.
Dealers said the lower money supply was attributed to the fund being drained from the banking system to settle the Bank of Thailand's bonds being auctioned last Friday.
The central bank on Friday arranged the bond auction worth 30 billion baht ($1.15 billion) which was raised from two billion baht orginally planned.
The central bank said the move was being made to mop up excess liquidity that would hit the market following the scheduled launch of a 78 billion baht Government Pension Fund (GPF) last week.
The one-month baht/dollar swap premium was traded at 7.50/8.50 satangs per dollar late against 8.25/9.00 in early morning.
